data.title: 准备以至少 30 秒的时间回答以下问题
data.subject: Talk about the most difficult aspects of learning.
data.answer: While learning English, it is pretty difficult to learn grammar rather than pronunciation because English grammar is very different from Chinese, which is my native language. It is not like Spanish and Italian or other European languages that are more similar to each other. Some may say English pronunciation is also very different from Chinese pronunciation, but I believe that listening and imitating how native English speakers say it can be helpful, and you don't have to sound exactly like a native speaker. Once my pronunciation does not hinder communication, I think I will be fine. As a result, learning grammar requires more attention to detail, especially when dealing with academic writing. For example, in Chinese, we put every adjective in front of a noun to describe it, while in English, adjectives can be a relative clause or other grammatical structures that can be put behind a noun. Therefore, it is very challenging when our first language interferes with the use of the second language. The most helpful resources would be a large amount of reading followed up by summarizing the reading and paraphrasing. Reading helps to make sure that I am exposed to all kinds of vocabulary and grammar regularly and gives me content knowledge, which I do not have to come up with when writing. This gives me a chance to focus more carefully on my language performance rather than struggling with what idea or content I am going to present. Later on, teachers may correct my mistakes or errors in my summary and paraphrasing, which could help me understand the grammar. I believe this is the best way for me to improve my grammar. (280 words)

options.content: Which is more difficult: grammar or pronunciation?

What resources were most helpful to you?
